title: Egret3D 1.2 发布，编辑器内测版同步上线

description: <p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201810/09082126/mt0ygxm4o88ojnt5.jpg!heading" data-img-size-val="5832,4002"/></p><p><strong>提问：@lilylee</strong></p><p><strong>今日锦囊答主： 赵生伟&nbsp; 角马原力创始人（微信ID：gnuforce）</strong></p><p>这两年流行的知识付费多为音频形式，以日更或者周更的形式，为订阅用户梳理某一方面的知识。听起来很新潮，但事实上，在线学习并不新鲜，如果愿意投入时间建立更加系统化的知识体系，你甚至还能通过在线学习取得一个宾夕法尼亚大学的文凭。</p><p>MOOC = Massive Open Online Courses = 大型开放式网络课程 ，想必大家或多或少有过接触，MOOC 有两个基本特征：1. 开放共享，任何人都可以通过互联网进行上课 2. 可扩张性，通过互联网，在线上课摆脱了线下授课的地点和人数束缚。在线上网课是一个大家常用的自我学习和提升的方式。海量的、优质的课程让你在世界各地都触手可及，满足自学提升的需求。</p><p>目前，国内外有一批优质的提供在线课程的“课程平台”，这些平台有的是和大学合作，有的是和科技公司合作，每个平台提供的学习资源也是各有特色。目前常用的、优质的MOOC平台有以下这些：</p><p>Coursera <a href="https://www.coursera.org/">https://www.coursera.org/</a> 是于2012年由斯坦福的教授创立。Coursera资源语种最丰富，现在除了完成课程并达到规定分数有证书外，还有付费的结课认证。在Coursera上还可以拿学位了，美国宾夕法尼亚大学就在Coursera上提供了在线硕士学位，前提是你已经有个学士学位。</p><p>Udacity <a href="https://cn.udacity.com/">https://cn.udacity.com/</a> </p><p>主攻理工科课程，适合程序员，偏向现实实用性课程。Udacity被称为是一所在线的“硅谷大学”，由来自硅谷的技术领袖设计课程，让每个人都能免费在线学习世界最高水平的IT课程。</p><p>edX <a href="https://www.edx.org/">https://www.edx.org/</a></p><p>edX是一个由麻省理工学院和哈佛大学创建的大规模开放在线课堂平台。国内的清华大学和北京大学也在edX设有课程。</p><p>中国大学MOOC <a href="https://www.icourse163.org/">https://www.icourse163.org/</a></p><p>中国大学MOOC是由网易与高教社携手推出的在线教育平台，有来自众多985高校的优质课程。</p><p>作家格拉德威尔在《异类》一书中指出：人们眼中的天才之所以卓越非凡，并非天资超人一等，而是付出了持续不断的努力。1万小时的锤炼是任何人从平凡变成超凡的必要条件。当然这个10000并不是确数，而是强调刻意的训练和学习的重要性。通过在线平台去学习，关键是持之以恒，显然不是每天开车或睡前听音频就能达成的，这也正是在线教育没有像知识付费一样普及的原因。</p><section><h3>1分钟知识锦囊是36氪的日更问答新栏目，旨在每天以一分钟为限，快问快答一个重要的商业问题。今天我们解答的是在线教育相关的问题。如果你对近期的商业世界还有什么疑问，欢迎在评论区给我们留言，锦囊负责找高手为你解答。</h3></section>
title: 1分钟知识锦囊 |  除了知识付费，还有什么系统性自我提升的办法？
IoT时代的声音域名是什么？这家公司讲给你听

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Our phone’s camera has become an important part of our lives. We use it to capture moments that matter to us, like memories with our families, and the small things we don’t want to forget, like handwritten notes or parking tickets. And now, thanks to advancements in computer vision, our camera can understand our world and help in new ways.</p><p>Today we introduced our most helpful camera yet on <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/pixel/google-pixel-3">Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL</a>, so you can turn your world into a playground and do more with what you see.<br/></p><h2>Introducing Playground, a new way to create and play</h2><p></p><p>From reenacting scenes in “Star Wars: The Last Jedi” to hanging out with Eleven from “Stranger Things,” you’re already having fun with AR Stickers. Today, we’re taking a big step forward by introducing Playground, a new mode in the Pixel camera to create and play with the world around you. It helps you bring more of your imagination to a scene with cameos from your favorite superheroes, stickers that animate around you and fun captions that put words where the action is.</p><p>Playground brings you more powerful AR experiences and uses AI to recommend content for expressing yourself in the moment. You can make your photos and videos come to life with Playmoji—characters that react to each other and to you—and tell a richer story by adding fun captions or animated stickers you’ll recognize from Gboard.</p><p></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Comp-1.gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/Comp-1.gif"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>You can snap photos on the back camera (left) or take selfies with Playmoji that respond to your facial expressions (right).</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Playground also works in selfie mode, so now you can up your selfie game by standing next to characters you love, like Iron Man from the Marvel Cinematic Universe. New packs for Weather, Pets, Sports and Signs let you have everyday fun, and coming later this year, you'll be able to sharpen your dance skills with moves from Childish Gambino.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Iron Man _ Blog%2FSocial (1).gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/Iron_Man___Blog2FSocial_1.gif"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Marvel Studios’ Avengers</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>And for those moments when you aren’t quite sure where to start, Playground makes real-time suggestions to recommend content based on the scene you’re in. Are you walking your dog? Cooking in the kitchen? Gardening in the backyard? Playground uses advanced computer vision and machine learning to recommend relevant Playmoji, stickers and captions to populate the scene.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--small h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--2 h-c-grid__col--offset-5 "><img alt="AR_Playground_Garden.gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/AR_Playground_Garden.gif"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Scene suggestions</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Once you’ve got your perfect shot, sharing with Playground is easy—with just a few taps straight from the camera.<br/></p><h2>Do more with what you see with Google Lens</h2><p>Last year with Pixel 2, we introduced Google Lens to help you do more with what you see, whether its finding an outfit you like, copying and searching text, or identifying that cute dog in the park. This year, we’ve integrated Lens even more into Pixel 3 for a faster, more helpful experience.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="LensKeynote_Menu_1.gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/LensKeynote_Menu_1.gif"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Lens Suggestions</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Lens is already a great way to quickly call a number, visit a URL, scan a QR code, and add an email address to your contacts. On Pixel 3, we’re introducing Lens Suggestions to bring these common actions right into the main Pixel camera. Simply point your camera, and with a single tap, call or save a phone number on a takeout menu, send an email right from a flyer, or open an address in Google Maps. This is all done on-device and takes advantage of Pixel Visual Core, so it doesn’t require an internet connection.</p><p>We’ve also made it even easier to get to the full Lens experience on Pixel 3—just long press in the camera. It’s a fast and convenient new way to access Lens.<br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Lens in Overview_Pixel3.gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/Lens_in_Overview_Pixel3.gif"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Lens from recent apps screen on Pixel 3</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Finally, we’re making Lens accessible from the recent apps screen on Pixel 3, so regardless of the app you’re in, Lens can help. Just drag up from the home button and long press on an image. It’s great for when you see an outfit you like while browsing the web or scrolling through an app.</p><p>With Google Lens and Playground, Pixel 3’s camera lets you do more with what you see and have fun with the world around you. Google Lens is available on all Pixel devices, with Playground on Pixel 3 first and coming to Pixel 1 and 2 soon. Preorder Pixel 3 or learn more on the <a href="https://g.co/hpvnyc">Google Store</a>.<br/></p></div></div></body></html>
title: See your world differently with Playground and Google Lens on Pixel 3

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Many of us share the same photos with the same people over and over, whether it’s photos of your children to their grandparents, or cute pics of your pup to your best friend. Every time, we have to find the photos, select the ones we want to share and send them to the right people. And that’s if we even remember to share them at all.</p><p>That’s why we made live albums, a new and easy way to share more of your memories from Google Photos. You can turn any album into a live album. Just choose the people (and pets) you want to see, and Google Photos will automatically add photos of them to your album as you take them. Then, you can share your album with family and friends so they can be a part of special moments as they happen—no manual updates needed. Live albums are rolling out now in a number of countries on Android, iOS and the web.<br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="live albums gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/image1_3SlT2nD.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><h3>A better photo frame that's always up to date </h3><p>Digital photo frames have been around for years, but they are hard to set up, the photos get old fast, and you can’t pull up a specific memory when you want it. Now, there’s a new and easier way to enjoy more of your memories at home with Google Photos on the new <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/home/google-home-hub/">Google Home Hub</a>.<br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="estelle" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/image3_zSjjHj3.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>You don’t need a memory card or any gear to turn your display into a photo frame, and with live albums, you and your loved ones will always have the latest photos front and center. Plus you can say things like “Hey Google, show my pictures from Chicago” and they’ll pop up on the display. Google Home Hub also adjusts the screen brightness and color temperature based on its surroundings, so your photos fit more naturally into your space.</p><p>And, you can turn your Pixel 3 into the same type of photo frame with the new Pixel Stand, bringing more of your memories into your home, office, or wherever you’re wirelessly charging your phone.<br/></p><h3>Top Shot and depth editing</h3><p>With Google Photos, we're also making it faster and easier to capture the perfect photo and give you editing tools to make your portraits pop.</p><p>Top Shot on Pixel 3 makes sure you always get the best shot—you know, the selfie where everyone actually has their eyes open. When you take a motion photo, Top Shot automatically captures alternate shots in HDR+, then recommends the best one—even if it’s not exactly when you hit the shutter. You can view the recommendation in your Google Photos app and scroll back and forth to see all the other frames. When you're ready, hit save.</p><p>Google Photos can also help you create the perfect portrait without fancy camera equipment or lots of time spent editing. With our new depth editor, you can adjust the background blur and change the focus of your portrait photos in just a few taps. You can also make the subject of your photo pop by leaving them in color, while changing the background to black and white.<br/></p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="depth editor" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/image2.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>These new editing features will be available on Pixel 3 and other phones that support portrait photos including Pixel 2 and Motorola phones such as the Moto G6.</p><p>With these updates to Google Photos, you can spend less time editing and sharing memories, and more time enjoying them.</p><p></p></div></div></body></html>
title: Live albums—a new way to share that’s always up to date

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>In May, we introduced <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/gmail/subject-write-emails-faster-smart-compose-gmail/">Smart Compose</a> in Gmail on the web, which uses machine learning to help you draft emails faster. It has already saved people from typing over 1 billion characters each week and now it can help you write emails even faster while you’re on the go. We’re bringing Smart Compose to the Gmail mobile app, starting with Pixel 3. Smart Compose will offer writing suggestions as you type and if you like what you see, just swipe right to use it.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Demo 1 animation.gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/Demo_1_animation.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Smart Compose has already rolled out globally in English. In the coming months, we’ll bring the experience to four new languages: Spanish, French, Italian and Portuguese. We’ll also bring it to more mobile devices beginning in 2019.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_carousel"><div class="h-c-page article-module"><div class="article-module glue-pagination h-c-carousel h-c-carousel--simple h-c-carousel--dark ng-cloak" data-glue-pagination-config="{cyclical: true}"><div class="h-c-carousel__wrap"><ul class="glue-carousel ng-cloak"
